title: Prayer Times Calendar
description: Returns all prayer times for a specific calendar month.
name: GetCalendar

Parameter.description: The decimal value for the latitude co-ordinate of the location you want the time computed for. Example: 51.75865125
The decimal value for the longitude co-ordinate of the location you want the time computed for. Example: -1.25387785
Optional. A gregorian calendar month. Example: 8 or 08 for August. If not specified, an annual calendar will be returned.
A gregorian calendar year. Example: 2014.

A prayer times calculation method. Methods identify various schools of thought about how to compute the timings. If not specified, it defaults to the closest authority based on the location or co-ordinates specified in the API call. This parameter accepts values from 0-12 and 99, as specified below:
* 0 - Shia Ithna-Ashari
1 - University of Islamic Sciences, Karachi
2 - Islamic Society of North America
3 - Muslim World League
4 - Umm Al-Qura University, Makkah
5 - Egyptian General Authority of Survey
7 - Institute of Geophysics, University of Tehran
8 - Gulf Region
9 - Kuwait
10 - Qatar
11 - Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura, Singapore
12 - Union Organization islamic de France
13 - Diyanet İşleri Başkanlığı, Turkey
14 - Spiritual Administration of Muslims of Russia
15 - Moonsighting Committee Worldwide (also requires shafaq parameter)
16 - Dubai (unofficial)
99 - Custom. See https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods
Which Shafaq to use if the method is Moonsighting Commitee Worldwide. Acceptable options are 'general', 'ahmer' and 'abyad'. Defaults to 'general'.
Comma Separated String of integers to offset timings returned by the API in minutes. Example: 5,3,5,7,9,7. See https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods
0 for Shafi (or the standard way), 1 for Hanafi. If you leave this empty, it defaults to Shafii.
0 for Standard (Mid Sunset to Sunrise), 1 for Jafari (Mid Sunset to Fajr). If you leave this empty, it defaults to Standard.
A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php . Example: Europe/London. If you do not specify this, we'll calcuate it using the co-ordinates you provide.

Method for adjusting times higher latitudes - for instance, if you are checking timings in the UK or Sweden.
1 - Middle of the Night
2 - One Seventh
3 - Angle Based
Number of days to adjust hijri date(s). Example: 1 or 2 or -1 or -2
Whether to return the prayer times in the iso8601 format. Example: true will return 2020-07-01T02:56:00+01:00 instead of 02:56

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
http://api.aladhan.com/v1/calendar/2017/4?latitude=51.508515&longitude=-0.1254872&method=2
http://api.aladhan.com/v1/calendar/2019?latitude=51.508515&longitude=-0.1254872&method=2

title: Prayer Times Calendar by city
description: Returns all prayer times for a specific calendar month by City.
name: GetCalendarByCitys

Parameter.description: A city name. Example: London
A country name or 2 character alpha ISO 3166 code. Examples: GB or United Kindom
State or province. A state name or abbreviation. Examples: Colorado / CO / Punjab / Bengal
Optional. A gregorian calendar month. Example: 8 or 08 for August. If not specified, an annual calendar will be returned.
A gregorian calendar year. Example: 2014.

A prayer times calculation method. Methods identify various schools of thought about how to compute the timings. Comma Separated String of integers to offset timings returned by the API in minutes. Example: 5,3,5,7,9,7. See https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods
0 for Shafi (or the standard way), 1 for Hanafi. If you leave this empty, it defaults to Shafii.

title: Prayer Times Hijri Calendar

Optional. A Hijri calendar month. Example: 9 or 09 for Ramadan. If not specified, an annual calendar will be returned.
A Hijri calendar year. Example: 1437.

A prayer times calculation method. Methods identify various schools of thought about how to compute the timings. If not specified, it defaults to the closest authority based on the location or co-ordinates specified in the API call. This parameter accepts values from 0-12 and 99, as specified below:

16 - Dubai (unofficial)
99 - Custom. See https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods

Comma Separated String of integers to offset timings returned by the API in minutes. Example: 5,3,5,7,9,7. See https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods
0 for Shafi (or the standard way), 1 for Hanafi. If you leave this empty, it defaults to Shafii.
0 for Standard (Mid Sunset to Sunrise), 1 for Jafari (Mid Sunset to Fajr). If you leave this empty, it defaults to Standard.

Method for adjusting times higher latitudes - for instance, if you are checking timings in the UK or Sweden.

2 - One Seventh
3 - Angle Based
Number of days to adjust hijri date(s). Example: 1 or 2 or -1 or -2
Whether to return the prayer times in the iso8601 format. Example: true will return 2020-07-01T02:56:00+01:00 instead of 02:56

title: Prayer Times Methods
description: Returns all the prayer times calculation methods supported by this API. For more information on how to use custom methods, see https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods.
name: GetMethods

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content: http://api.aladhan.com/v1/methods

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: Timings
description: Returns all prayer times for a specific date.
name: GetTimings

Parameter.description: A date in the DD-MM-YYYY format. Default's to the current date via an HTTP 301.
The decimal value for the latitude co-ordinate of the location you want the time computed for. Example: 51.75865125
The decimal value for the longitude co-ordinate of the location you want the time computed for. Example: -1.25387785

A prayer times calculation method. Methods identify various schools of thought about how to compute the timings. If not specified, it defaults to the closest authority based on the location or co-ordinates specified in the API call. This parameter accepts values from 0-12 and 99, as specified below:
* 0 - Shia Ithna-Ashari
0 - Shia Ithna-Ashari
1 - University of Islamic Sciences, Karachi
2 - Islamic Society of North America
3 - Muslim World League
4 - Umm Al-Qura University, Makkah
5 - Egyptian General Authority of Survey
7 - Institute of Geophysics, University of Tehran
8 - Gulf Region
9 - Kuwait
10 - Qatar
11 - Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura, Singapore
12 - Union Organization islamic de France
13 - Diyanet İşleri Başkanlığı, Turkey
14 - Spiritual Administration of Muslims of Russia
15 - Moonsighting Committee Worldwide (also requires shafaq parameter)
16 - Dubai (unofficial)
99 - Custom. See https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods
Which Shafaq to use if the method is Moonsighting Commitee Worldwide. Acceptable options are 'general', 'ahmer' and 'abyad'. Defaults to 'general'.
Comma Separated String of integers to offset timings returned by the API in minutes. Example: 5,3,5,7,9,7. See https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods
0 for Shafi (or the standard way), 1 for Hanafi. If you leave this empty, it defaults to Shafii.
0 for Standard (Mid Sunset to Sunrise), 1 for Jafari (Mid Sunset to Fajr). If you leave this empty, it defaults to Standard.
A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php . Example: Europe/London. If you do not specify this, we'll calcuate it using the co-ordinates you provide.

Method for adjusting times higher latitudes - for instance, if you are checking timings in the UK or Sweden.
1 - Middle of the Night
2 - One Seventh
3 - Angle Based
Number of days to adjust hijri date(s). Example: 1 or 2 or -1 or -2
Whether to return the prayer times in the iso8601 format. Example: true will return 2020-07-01T02:56:00+01:00 instead of 02:56

examples.content: http://api.aladhan.com/v1/timings/17-07-2007?latitude=51.508515&longitude=-0.1254872&method=2
